title: Open DeFi Analytics Platform for Cardano
summary: Cardano lacks a unified, open-source analytics tool for DEX activity, leaving developers and users with fragmented or closed data sources for tracking liquidity, trading patterns, and market behavior.
solution: Build an open-source platform that unifies Cardano DEX data, providing transparent analytics on liquidity, trading patterns, and user activity through a clean API and easily accessible insights.
proposer_relevant_experience: My name is Christoffer, and I have worked on various Cardano projects. I have extensive experience building software projects and delivering high-quality code on time. I am super excited to contribute to the growth of the Cardano ecosystem with this project proposal. Please see my GitHub link for the first MVP of this project. Here my github with my MVP code for demonstration purposes: [https://github\.com/chris\-r\-99/cardano\-defi\-analytics\.](https://github.com/chris-r-99/cardano-defi-analytics.) My linked in profile: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/christoffer\-r\-59a8aa1bb/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christoffer-r-59a8aa1bb/)

fields.title: Campaign Category

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: This project is innovative because it creates the first fully open, ecosystem-wide analytics layer for Cardano DeFi. Existing tools are either closed, single-DEX, or offer only partial insights. Our approach unifies data from multiple DEXs into a transparent, standardized framework that anyone can verify, extend, or integrate into their own applications. By combining contract-aware parsing, shared schemas, and advanced analytics in an open-source package, the project delivers capabilities not available in any current solution and provides a reusable foundation for future DeFi research and development on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP will demonstrate the core functionality of the analytics platform by parsing a limited set of Cardano DEX events, storing the results in a local database, and exposing them through a simple REST API. It will show basic liquidity and swap decoding, sample analytics endpoints, and a minimal frontend that visualizes these metrics.



The MVP will be fully accessible through a public GitHub repository, with open-source code, setup instructions, and example API calls. A running demo instance or local setup guide will allow developers to test the API, explore parsed data, and see how the system can scale into a full analytics solution.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: Success will be measured by the platform’s ability to reliably parse, store, and expose DEX data across multiple Cardano protocols. Key indicators include: accurate decoding of swaps and liquidity events verified against on-chain explorers; stable API endpoints returning consistent metrics; successful syncing of a defined block range without errors and community feedback.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
We will build an open-source analytics platform that unifies Cardano DEX data into a single, transparent system. The backend will parse on-chain transactions from major DEX smart contracts, normalize the results into a consistent schema, and store them in a local database. A documented REST API will expose liquidity events, swaps, volumes, and user activity in a reliable and developer-friendly format.



This solution directly addresses the current fragmentation and lack of transparency by eliminating the need for custom parsers or closed tools. Developers gain a shared, verifiable data layer they can integrate into dashboards, bots, research, or monitoring tools. By providing standardized metrics across multiple DEXs, the platform ensures accurate comparisons, easier analysis, and a trustworthy foundation for Cardano DeFi insights.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer: This project strengthens the Cardano ecosystem by making DeFi activity transparent, accessible, and easy to verify. Developers can benefit from a shared, open-source analytics layer that removes the need to build custom DEX parsers, saving time and reducing complexity. Users and community members can independently fact-check claims, better understand risks, and make more informed decisions. By improving transparency and lowering technical barriers, the project boosts trust, encourages responsible innovation, and supports healthier growth across the entire Cardano DeFi ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
I have a strong track record of delivering high-quality Cardano development work as an independent builder. With a master’s degree in computer science and extensive experience building software system and data pipelines. I am fully capable of implementing this project end-to-end. I have already delivered multiple Cardano-related prototypes and open-source contributions, demonstrating both technical competence and reliability.



I work transparently and publicly: all code will be developed in an open GitHub repository. This allows the community to verify the work as it is being produced.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Core Analytics Framework

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
- Initial analytics framework capable of ingesting Cardano blocks/transactions.
- Basic parser structure for detecting DEX-related events (swaps, liquidity actions).
- Normalized data schema defined and implemented in a local database.
- First REST API endpoints exposing raw parsed data.
- Documentation covering setup, schema overview, and API basics.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- The system can sync a selected block range and store parsed DEX-related events.
- REST endpoints return correct, schema-compliant JSON.
- README includes setup instructions, configuration steps, and data format details.
- Error handling is implemented for malformed or missing data.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- Public GitHub repository with implemented framework, schema, and endpoints.
- Demo script showing parsed results from a synced block segment.
- Milestone summary post and release notes documenting deliverables.

sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Smart Contract Integration

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
- Contract-aware parsing for major Cardano DEXs (e.g., MinSwap, WingRiders, SundaeSwap).
- Accurate decoding of swaps, deposits, withdrawals, and LP token operations.
- Expanded database schema covering pool structures and token paths.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- Parser produces deterministic, validated records for each supported DEX.
- Decoded amounts match spot-checked transactions on explorers.
- Documentation describes DEX-specific quirks, assumptions, and fallback behavior.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- Updated GitHub codebase with DEX modules and expanded schema.
- Test results and fixtures included in the repository.
- Technical report mapping contract calls to parsed output with examples.
- Documentation as Markdown file in the repository

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
1. Core Analytics Framework – 40,000 ADA

Backend development (parsing, schema design, data ingestion): 30,000 ADA

Initial API implementation & documentation: 7,000 ADA

Project planning and milestone reporting: 3,000 ADA





2. Smart Contract Integration – 25,000 ADA

DEX contract analysis and parser development: 17,000 ADA

Testing and validation of decoded events: 5,000 ADA

Documentation of protocol behavior and edge cases: 3,000 ADA



3. Advanced Analytics Features – 25,000 ADA

Development of analytics endpoints (TVL, volume, flows): 17,000 ADA

Performance tuning and indexing improvements: 5,000 ADA

Documentation and usage examples: 3,000 ADA



4. Deployment & Reliability Enhancements – 14,000 ADA

Deployment scripts, environment setup, and Docker support: 6,000 ADA

Test suite, profiling, and reliability improvements: 5,000 ADA

Final reporting, close-out video, and polishing documentation: 3,000 ADA

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer: The cost delivers strong value because it funds an open-source analytics platform that the entire Cardano ecosystem can use for free. As a solo developer, nearly all resources go directly into building the tool, not overhead. The MIT-licensed code becomes a long-term public good, reducing duplicated effort and giving developers, researchers, and users transparent, reliable DEX data. A single investment produces reusable infrastructure that benefits many projects and improves overall DeFi transparency.
